Package pieces

Class Pawn

java.lang.Object
pieces.Piece
pieces.Pawn
public class Pawn extends Piece
A subclass of Piece, this class contains Pawn specific implementations of the methods validMove(), standardMove(), updateLocation(), hasNoCollisions(), and generateMoves().

In order for en passant to work, the method validMoveMade() within Chessboard must be called, or more specifically, the pawns validMove() method must be called. If it is not called, the piece that would be taken via en passant will remain on the board.

Author:
Julius Ramirez

      int points

    • firstMove

      public boolean firstMove
      True if this is the pawn is still on it's first move ever, false if not.

    • enPassantable

      public boolean enPassantable
      True if en passant may be done on this pawn, false if not. Used in validMove() detection, specifically in the validEnPassantMove() method.

    • didEnPassant

      public boolean didEnPassant
      True if the pawn has done en passant, false if not. Used in the boardUpdate() method in the chessboard class so that the board may be properly updated.

  • Constructor Details

    • Pawn

      public Pawn(boolean white, org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell shell)
      Subclass constructor of Piece(boolean).
      Parameters:
      white - true if piece is white, false if black
      shell - the graphical shell. Used to set the image of the piece.

  • Method Details

    • removeEnPassantMove

      public void removeEnPassantMove()
      This sets the didEnPassant field to false so that the piece below this pawn will not constantly get deleted. It is used only in the Chessboard classes updateBoard() method.

    • updateLocation

      public void updateLocation(int x, int y)
      This method updates the location of a the piece.

      Additionally, it will set the firstMove field to false and set the enPassantable field accordingly depending on if an en passant move may be done on the pawn.

      Overrides:
      updateLocation in class Piece
      Parameters:
      x - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.
      y - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.

    • validMove

      public boolean validMove(int x, int y, Tile[][] tiles)
      This method returns a boolean indicating if the move is valid. A move is valid if it is a standard move of that piece, and if it the movement does not collide with pieces already on the board. It assumes that the new coordinate is different than the current pieces coordinate.

      Due to the special en passant move, it also checks to see if a legal en passant move has been made. This is where didEnPassant is set to true.

      Overrides:
      validMove in class Piece
      Parameters:
      x - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.
      y - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.
      tiles - a 2D array containing Tile objects that contain a Piece field.
      Returns:
      a boolean, true if move can be made, false if not.

    • hasNoCollisions

      public boolean hasNoCollisions(int x, int y, Tile[][] tiles)
      Returns a boolean indicating if the piece collides with a friendly piece at the x/y coordinate. Enemy collisions are allowed.

      Due to the creation of generateMoves() this method could be entirely scrapped, however special moves such as en passant or castling have their fields updated accordingly during this method call and thus removal requires more structural changes.

      Additionally, it checks to see if a piece is in the way of the movement to the x/y coordinate and if the pawn has moved 2 spaces only on its first move.

      Specified by:
      hasNoCollisions in class Piece
      Parameters:
      x - any integer between 0-7 inclusive
      y - any integer between 0-7 inclusive
      tiles - a 2D list containing Tile objects which contain an accessible Piece field.
      Returns:
      true if no piece would block the move, false if a piece is blocking the move or if

    • standardMove

      public boolean standardMove(int x, int y)
      This method checks if the player is moving their pawn in the right direction based on the pieces color and also ensures that if they move two spaces, it is only on the first move.
      Specified by:
      standardMove in class Piece
      Parameters:
      x - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.
      y - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.
      Returns:
      a boolean, true if a pawn has moved in the right direction/amount of spaces, false if non standard movement or moved beyond legal range.

    • validEnPassantMove

      private boolean validEnPassantMove(int x, int y, Tile[][] tiles)
      This method checks to see if an en passant move has been made. If the x/y coordinate is empty, in the validMove() method call, this method will be called which will check the space above or below and see if there is a pawn there. If an opponents pawn is there and the en passant boolean is true, it returns true.
      Parameters:
      x - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.
      y - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.
      tiles - a 2D array containing Tile objects that contain a Piece field
      Returns:
      a boolean, true if a legal en passant move has been made, false if not

    • promotion

      public boolean promotion()
      This method simply returns if the pawn is now on the opposite side of the board so that it may then be promoted to some other piece
      Returns:
      true if the pawn is to be promoted, false if not.

    • generateMoves

      public List<Coordinate> generateMoves(Tile[][] tiles)
      Description copied from class: Piece
      This method generates most of the valid moves a piece can do in terms of standard piece movement and no collisions made. It does NOT filter out non-valid check related moves (i.e. moves that keep the king in check/put the king in check).
      Specified by:
      generateMoves in class Piece
      Parameters:
      tiles - tiles a 2D list containing Tile objects which contain an accessible Piece field.
      Returns:
      a List of Coordinate objects which are spaces where the piece can possibly move.

    • diagonalHelper

      private void diagonalHelper(int x, int y, Tile[][] tiles, List<Coordinate> coordinates)
      This helper is used to determine if the given diagonal x/y coordinate from a specific pawn is a valid spot to be moved onto. It is valid if the diagonal has an enemy piece, or if it is an empty tile and above/below is a pawn that can have en passant done on it.
      Parameters:
      x - The integer x, between 0-7 inclusive, to be moved to.
      y - The integer y, between 0-7 inclusive, to be moved to.
      tiles - a 2D array containing Tile objects which have an obtainable Piece field.
      coordinates - a List of Coordinate objects indicating where the piece can move onto.
